Evaluation_Questions: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken
What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was
Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved
Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
How would you summarize this course for a fellow student?  Would you recommend it to another student?  Why or why not
Comments_List: This course is well-structured. Every concept is followed with examples, helping students to understand well.
Maria Ciarleglio is arguably the strongest teacher in the school of public health.  She is just exceptional.  This class is tough, but when you're done you will have learned a lot.
Excellent. It would be great if the professor did 20-30 minutes of actual data analysis in class in conjunction with lecture material rather than just reviewing the code.

Strengths - Practical rundown to commonly used and widely applicable survival analysis techniques (mostly in SAS, but in R as well).
Weaknesses - Course lectures mostly slide based (understandable due to coding nature of course). Office hours helpful for more thorough explanations.

good course, biggest suggestion is that the material could have been heavily condensed (slides were often wordy making it hard to stay engaged during dense sections). also would recommend switching to one programming language (preferably R, as there are better packages now)

strength: clear instruction and available TA
weakness: needs better calc overview in beginning

This course is one of my favorite courses in YSPH. It is well organized, very clear PPT, and it covers very important materials.  Highly recommend if you wanna learn more about public health and data science.

Strengths:
1. The homework of this course help me get a deeper understanding of the course material.
2. The ppt slides are very clear and well organized
Weakness
1. It would be better if we can do a project
Excellent slides in each lecture. Very clear explanation.
The lecture is well prepared and well organized.

This course addressed the topic of survival analysis very well. You could find every important detail in the handout materials. The logic of the content is fluent and flawless. It is a deep subject, but the course makes it easy to pick up.

excellent 
taught lots of concepts clearly, homework and assessment are properly created
I just want to say the course is awesome! Very clear and highly structured.
Excellent.She is always clear and instructive.
Maria is a very nice professor, and the materials she covers are very useful in data analysis.
Maria Ciarleglio is arguably the strongest teacher in the school of public health.  She is just exceptional.  This class is tough, but when you're done you will have learned a lot.
Great lecturer. Simplifies a rather difficult topic.
excellent teaching; materials she covered can not be clearer
Excellent instructor. Very knowledgeable and approachable. Willing to meet outside of office hours if needed. Wants to see students succeed.
very helpful, good instructor, might be helpful to have more engagement during lectures
very clear in lectures, very organized slides
Strengths: very clear and open to questions, very approachable
Maria is the best! She explains everything clearly, and she is  very patient in class. She has very organized PPT which helps us a lot.
Explanation is very clear. She is very kind and warm-hearted.

Professor Ciarleglio is very amiable and patient to her students. She is good at making the concept easy to understand and remember. She explains things clearly, and she is very responsive to her students.

knowledgeable 
able to explain concepts clearing at a good pace
answer questions patiently
responsible
The best course of this semester. I strongly recommend this course.
required AP/MPH course, which is maybe the most clinically relevant survival class you could ever take.  Great class, prepare to learn.
Great, highly recommended to anyone working in RCTS and with survival data.

Practical uses of survival analysis techniques. Would recommend for those interested in applied biostats or those who think they will need to conduct survival analysis (highly recommend for epi students).
good course, may be a bit easy for biostatistics students
Definitely recommend, it's a tough course but you learn a lot
I strongly recommend this course, which is very useful for our career in clinical trial studies.

good introduction to survival analysis, instructor is knowledgeable and helpful
highly recommended
Very helpful both for knowing the overall structure and process of analysis and modeling and the details of survival analysis.
